question: The model in which one kernel thread is mapped to many user-level threads is called ___________
options: ['a) Many to One model', 'b) One to Many model', 'c) Many to Many model', 'd) One to One model']

question: The model in which one user-level thread is mapped to many kernel level threads is called ___________
options: ['a) Many to One model', 'b) One to Many model', 'c) Many to Many model', 'd) One to One model']

question: In the Many to One model, if a thread makes a blocking system call ___________
options: ['a) the entire process will be blocked', 'b) a part of the process will stay blocked, with the rest running', 'c) the entire process will run', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the entire process will be blocked
option2: b) a part of the process will stay blocked, with the rest running
option3: c) the entire process will run

question: In the Many to One model, multiple threads are unable to run in parallel on multiprocessors because of ___________
options: ['a) only one thread can access the kernel at a time', 'b) many user threads have access to just one kernel thread', 'c) there is only one kernel thread', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) only one thread can access the kernel at a time
option2: b) many user threads have access to just one kernel thread
option3: c) there is only one kernel thread

question: The One to One model allows ___________
options: ['a) increased concurrency', 'b) decreased concurrency', 'c) increased or decreased concurrency', 'd) concurrency equivalent to other models']
option4: d) concurrency equivalent to other models

question: In the One to One model when a thread makes a blocking system call ___________
options: ['a) other threads are strictly prohibited from running', 'b) other threads are allowed to run', 'c) other threads only from other processes are allowed to run', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) other threads are strictly prohibited from running
option2: b) other threads are allowed to run
option3: c) other threads only from other processes are allowed to run

question: Which of the following is the drawback of the One to One Model?
options: ['a) increased concurrency provided by this model', 'b) decreased concurrency provided by this model', 'c) creating so many threads at once can crash the system', 'd) creating a user thread requires creating the corresponding kernel thread']
option1: a) increased concurrency provided by this model
option2: b) decreased concurrency provided by this model
option3: c) creating so many threads at once can crash the system
option4: d) creating a user thread requires creating the corresponding kernel thread

question: When is the Many to One model at an advantage?
options: ['a) When the program does not need multithreading', 'b) When the program has to be multi-threaded', 'c) When there is a single processor', 'd) None of the mentioned']
option1: a) When the program does not need multithreading
option2: b) When the program has to be multi-threaded
option3: c) When there is a single processor

question: In the Many to Many model true concurrency cannot be gained because ___________
options: ['a) the kernel can schedule only one thread at a time', 'b) there are too many threads to handle', 'c) it is hard to map threads with each other', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) the kernel can schedule only one thread at a time
option2: b) there are too many threads to handle
option3: c) it is hard to map threads with each other

question: In the Many to Many models when a thread performs a blocking system call ___________
options: ['a) other threads are strictly prohibited from running', 'b) other threads are allowed to run', 'c) other threads only from other processes are allowed to run', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) other threads are strictly prohibited from running
option2: b) other threads are allowed to run
option3: c) other threads only from other processes are allowed to run
